definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)

sentences.english: Make no expense but to do good to others or yourself; i. e. , waste nothing.
sentences.chinese: 花錢要花在利人利己的事情上，比如說，杜絕浪費。

sentences.english: But we are also strongly self-interested beings.
sentences.chinese: 但同時我們也是極其利己的生物。

sentences.english: Both drives him to become an extreme egoist.
sentences.chinese: 兩者驅使他成爲一個極端的利己主義者。

sentences.english: The participant's behaviour can be explained by simple economic self-interest.
sentences.chinese: 被試的行爲可以通過經濟上的利己主義來解釋。

sentences.english: The only rule of the market place was dog-eat-dog .
sentences.chinese: 市場上的唯一準則是損人利己。

sentences.english: Not only does it help myself but also protects the environment, which is highly important.
sentences.chinese: 不但利己也利人，保護環境可是頭等大事。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the national egoism had also been expanded and developed viciously.
sentences.chinese: 但同時蘇聯的民族利己主義也出現了惡性的膨脹發展。

sentences.english: The roadmap includes a measure of self-serving guff about the evils of shareholder democracy.
sentences.chinese: 有關股東民主弊病的利己廢話也赫然出現在路線圖中。
這是一個徹頭徹尾的利己主義者。

sentences.english: Sharing of information is good for everybody.
There remains as a third category the intolerance caused by self-interest.
sentences.chinese: 利己主義還可帶來第三種的“不容忍”。

sentences.english: Evil stems from human instinct and the selfish instincts of the lost degree of altruism.
sentences.chinese: 惡產生於人利己本能與利他本能的失度。

sentences.english: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to yourself and others.
sentences.chinese: 當你的言談舉止利人利己時，幸福就會來到你身邊。

sentences.english: Never do anything to your profit at another's expense.
sentences.chinese: 切不可作任何損人利己的事。

sentences.english: Japanese politics is tainted with egoism and populism.
sentences.chinese: 日本政治帶有利己主義和民粹主義的風氣。

sentences.english: He who oppresses the poor to increase his wealth and he who gives gifts to the rich-both come to poverty. Sayings of the Wise
sentences.chinese: 欺壓貧窮爲要利己的，並送禮與富戶的，都必缺乏。

definition: harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.
pinyin: ren2 bu4 wei4 ji3 , tian1 zhu1 di4 mie4
